triples.name: Evolutionary dynamics
triples.relevance: Core theoretical framework for studying how strategies and cooperation evolve over time in populations.

triples.name: Social network
triples.relevance: The foundational structure in which higher-order interactions and group cooperation occur.

triples.name: Public goods game
triples.relevance: The game-theoretic model used to study cooperation dynamics in groups.

triples.name: Hypergraph
triples.relevance: Novel application of hypergraphs to model higher-order interactions where groups of multiple agents interact simultaneously.

triples.name: Replicator equation
triples.relevance: Mathematical framework for analyzing how strategy frequencies change in populations and link to well-mixed evolutionary dynamics.

triples.name: Cooperative game theory
triples.relevance: Theoretical foundation for understanding group cooperation and binding agreements in games.
